extendedIngredients.name: olives
extendedIngredients.original: 10 ounces large black and green olives, pitted and coarsely chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: black and green olives, pitted and coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: fresh rosemary leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 3 cloves garlic, peeled, crushed and sliced

title: Roast Trout with Black and Green Olives: Trota Arrosto con Olive Nere e Verdi
summary: Roast Trout with Black and Green Olives: Trotan Arrosto con Olive Nere e Verdi is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe with 6 servings. One serving contains 481 calories, 39g of protein, and 34g of fat. For $5.59 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as an expensive main course. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. 3 people have made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up olives, rosemary leaves, garlic, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 40 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 74%, which is solid. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as Crocchette di miglio, carote e olive nere, Duck With Black Olives And Black Olive Risotto, and Easy Black Olive Tapenade (with a Green Olive version too!).
instructions: Preheat the grill or broiler.                          In a small saute pan, heat the olive oil over medium-low heat, then add the rosemary and garlic. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the olives and cook another 3 minutes.                          Lay each trout out on 6 sheets of aluminum foil and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle some of the olive mixture over each fillet. Wrap each fillet with 2 slices of pancetta, securing with a toothpick.                          Wrap fillets in the foil and grill or broil for 10 minutes, until fish is cooked through. Serve immediately.

steps.step: In a small saute pan, heat the olive oil over medium-low heat, then add the rosemary and garlic. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the olives and cook another 3 minutes.
Lay each trout out on 6 sheets of aluminum foil and season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle some of the olive mixture over each fillet. Wrap each fillet with 2 slices of pancetta, securing with a toothpick.
Wrap fillets in the foil and grill or broil for 10 minutes, until fish is cooked through.
